subject: AI & Agents
title: Expert Systems: Knowledge in a Box
description: A short lesson to help you apply Expert Systems: Knowledge in a Box.

hook.text: By the 1970s, AI researchers tried a new approach: just ask human experts and code their rules.

buildup.text: Expert systems were programs filled with hand-written if-then rules from specialists.

discovery.text: MYCIN diagnosed blood infections better than some doctors using 600 carefully crafted rules.

twist.text: Rules are brittle. One edge case the experts forgot could crash the whole system.

climax.text: Companies spent millions on expert systems that became impossible to maintain.

punchline.text: You can't bottle expertise in if-then statements.

quiz.question: What was a major problem with expert systems?
options: Hand-written rules were brittle and hard to maintain
They were too slow to run
